sentences.en: A shortlist of applicants may be invited for an interview.
sentences.cn: 入围申请人可能将被邀请参加面试.

sentences.en: At the meeting, the committee will arrive at an initial shortlist of qualified candidates.
sentences.cn: 在会议上, 委员会会列出一张合格申请人的初选名单.

sentences.en: He is on the shortlist for the job.
sentences.cn: 他列入了谋职者的候选人名单上.

sentences.en: He was on the shortlist for the job.
sentences.cn: 他列入了谋职者的决选人名单上.

sentences.en: He was shortlisted for the Nobel Prize for literature several times.
sentences.cn: 他曾数次获得诺贝尔文学奖提名。

sentences.en: I am not surprised that the Booker Prize jury included it on their shortlist.
sentences.cn: 我毫不惊讶布克奖评委会将其列在入选名单中。

sentences.en: I've been interviewing candidates for a research job and have had a very good shortlist.
sentences.cn: 我在为一项研究工作面试候选人,并有了一份非常好的入围名单.

sentences.en: If you've been asked for an interview you are probably on a shortlist of no more than six.
sentences.cn: 如果你已经被要求参加面试，你很可能在不超过6人的候选名单上。

sentences.en: Now it would appear that long - standing target David Villa at the top of Chelsea's shortlist.
sentences.cn: 现在看来,切尔西一直渴望的大卫-比利亚成为蓝军的首选.

sentences.en: This year's format was different, involving 96 journalists and a shortlist of 50 players worldwide.
sentences.cn: 但今年的评选有所不同, 参与投票的记者增加至96名,“金球奖”的50名候选人也扩大到了世界各地的俱乐部.

sentences.en: We have to choose a new manager from a shortlist of five candidates.
sentences.cn: 我们得从最终入选名单上的五位候选人中选出一位新经理.

sentences.en: You described her as the token woman on the shortlist.
sentences.cn: 你把她形容为入围名单上象征性的女性人选。

trans.tran_en: If someone is on a shortlist, for example, for a job or a prize, they are one of a small group of people who have been chosen from a larger group. The successful person is then chosen from the small group.
If someone or something is shortlisted for a job or a prize, they are put on a shortlist

trans.tran_cn: <英>供最后挑选（或考虑）用的候选人名单
trans.tran_en: If someone or something is shortlisted for a job or a prize, they are put on a shortlist
